DOCNAME: CASE OF KHUMAYDOV AND KHUMAYDOV v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Procedural aspect)
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in the village of GPE , LOC , in GPE .
CARDINAL . The first applicant was married to PERSON , born in DATE . They are the parents of the second applicant . At the material time PERSON worked as a manager at GPE railway station .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicants’ family lived at QUANTITY in GPE village . On TIME of DATE the applicants’ neighbours noticed a white PERSON vehicle parked not far from the applicants’ house .

CARDINAL . At TIME PERSON , PERSON colleague , saw CARDINAL UAZ-CARDINAL vehicles parked near the special task force checkpoint located in the railway station and CARDINAL armed men in camouflage uniforms climbing into them . Then the vehicles drove away towards PERSON Street .

CARDINAL . At TIME went to work . According to her neighbours , as soon as she left the house the white PERSON that had been parked near her house drove off . When PERSON turned from PERSON Street into FAC it followed her .

CARDINAL . Mr NORP , a railway station employee , was behind PERSON on his way to work and saw her and the PERSON turning into FAC . TIME , when he reached FAC , he saw the PERSON swaying slightly and no trace of PERSON .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicants’ neighbour , PERSON , saw a blue and a khaki UAZCARDINAL vehicle with aerials on their roofs moving along FAC towards FAC .
CARDINAL . PERSON has not been seen since then .
CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE PERSON left her house . She has not been seen since then .

CARDINAL . PERSON had not arrived at her office by TIME Her colleagues began to worry and went to her house . The first applicant told them that his wife had left for work . The colleagues and the first applicant followed PERSON footprints , visible on the fresh layer of snow . The footprints stopped at the crossroads of PERSON and FAC , where Mr NORP had seen the PERSON .

CARDINAL . The first applicant went to the police station to report his wife ’s disappearance . Police officers told him that they could not deal promptly with his complaint as they were having a DATE meeting . However , they assigned an investigator to deal with the matter .
CARDINAL . DATE investigators visited the scene of the incident and photographed tyre prints .

CARDINAL . The first applicant complained about his wife ’s disappearance to various official bodies , including the NORP President , the NORP State Duma , the NORP administration and ORG . The majority of his complaints were forwarded to ORG offices at different levels .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the ORG authorities refused to institute criminal proceedings related to PERSON disappearance .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of LOC ( “ the district prosecutor ’s office ” ) informed the first applicant that they had quashed the decision refusing to investigate his wife ’s disappearance and instituted criminal proceedings under LAW of LAW ( “ kidnapping ” ) . The case file was assigned the number DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office suspended the investigation in case no . DATE for failure to identify those responsible .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant complained about his wife ’s kidnapping to the military prosecutor ’s office of military unit no . DATE ( “ the unit prosecutor ’s office ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the military prosecutor ’s office of ORG ( “ the ORG prosecutor ’s office ” ) forwarded the first applicant ’s complaint to the unit prosecutor ’s office .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE forwarded the first applicant ’s complaint to the district prosecutor ’s office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the unit prosecutor ’s office informed the first applicant that they had no information either on PERSON whereabouts or on the implication of any military personnel in her kidnapping .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE forwarded the first applicant ’s complaint to the district prosecutor ’s office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office resumed the investigation in case no . DATE . On DATE they notified the first applicant accordingly and commented that investigative measures were being taken to solve the crime . They also noted that the law enforcement agencies of GPE had not carried out any special operations for PERSON arrest and that her dead body had not been discovered .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG forwarded to the ORG prosecutor ’s office the first applicant ’s complaint about the disappearance of PERSON who “ had been abducted by federal military servicemen in DATE ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office informed the first applicant that the investigation in case no . DATE had been suspended and then resumed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE ( “ the NORP FSB ” ) informed the first applicant that they had not arrested PERSON as there had been no legal grounds for it .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE informed the first applicant of the progress in the investigation in case no . DATE . They listed investigative measures taken , such as ORG interviews and requests for information sent to law - enforcement agencies and to penitentiary institutions , and commented that those measures had been futile but that investigators continued to take requisite steps to solve the crime .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation in case no . DATE was suspended .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG of the ORG informed the first applicant that they had not carried out any special operations in relation to PERSON in the village of GPE DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the unit prosecutor ’s office informed the first applicant that they had no information on implication of the ORG servicemen in his wife ’s kidnapping .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE forwarded the first applicant ’s complaint to the department of the interior of LOC ( “ ROVD ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG prosecutor ’s office informed the first applicant that the inquiry carried out by the unit prosecutor ’s office had been fruitless and advised that he request further information related to the search for his wife from the district prosecutor ’s office .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ROVD informed the first applicant that they were taking measures to solve PERSON kidnapping .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE informed the first applicant of measures taken to solve his wife ’s kidnapping and noted that the investigation was under way . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE sent a similar letter to the first applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the unit prosecutor ’s office informed the first applicant that an inquiry into his wife ’s disappearance had not established any involvement by military personnel .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE informed the first applicant that PERSON whereabouts had not been established and that the district prosecutor ’s office had been instructed to search for her more vigorously . On DATE the ROVD informed the first applicant that they were taking requisite measures to establish his wife ’s whereabouts .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office informed the Chair of ORG of GPE that they had quashed the decision of DATE and resumed the investigation in case no . DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP Ministry of the ORG informed the first applicant that various law enforcement agencies were actively searching for his wife .
CARDINAL . In reply to CARDINAL of the first applicant ’s recurrent complaints the ORG prosecutor ’s office informed him on DATE that they had no new information concerning PERSON kidnapping .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office informed the first applicant that they had quashed the decision of DATE and resumed the investigation on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE and DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE forwarded the first applicant ’s complaints to the district prosecutor ’s office .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation in case no . DATE was suspended for failure to identify those responsible .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Shelkovskoy District Court of GPE declared PERSON missing as from DATE .
DATE . On DATE ORG informed the first applicant that they had no information on PERSON whereabouts .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG prosecutor ’s office forwarded the first applicant ’s complaint to the unit prosecutor ’s office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office replied to the first applicant ’s complaint that they had already carried out a thorough inquiry into the matters complained of . They also noted that , although the investigation had been suspended on DATE , measures were being taken to solve the crime .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant requested ORG , ORG and ORG the NORP President in ORG to help him to find his wife .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE informed the first applicant that investigative measures were being taken to establish PERSON whereabouts .
CARDINAL . On DATE the military commander of GPE ordered that the military commander ’s office of LOC carry out an inquiry into PERSON disappearance .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the ORG , acting on the first applicant ’s behalf , requested information from the district prosecutor ’s office on progress in the investigation in case no . DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of military unit no . CARDINAL requested information on special operations carried out on DATE from a number of ORG officials .
CARDINAL . On DATE the military commander of LOC ordered the ROVD to take measures to establish PERSON whereabouts .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of military unit no . CARDINAL informed the first applicant that law enforcement agencies had not carried out any special operations in LOC on DATE and had not arrested PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ROVD informed the first applicant that measures were being taken to solve his wife ’s kidnapping .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE replied to the PERSON ’s letter of CARDINAL DATE stating that the investigation of PERSON kidnapping was underway and that the first applicant had been granted victim status .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant reported his wife ’s disappearance to the department of the interior of LOC ( “ ROVD ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE an investigator of the ROVD inspected the Magomadovs’ house and the surrounding area but found no items of interest .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator of the ROVD refused to institute criminal proceedings related to PERSON disappearance for lack of evidence of a crime .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office quashed the decision of DATE and instituted an investigation into PERSON kidnapping under LAW of LAW . The case file was assigned the number DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was granted victim status and questioned . He stated that at TIME on DATE his wife had left for work . She had some work - related documents with her . At TIME Ms B. had come to his house searching for PERSON who had not arrived at work , although it took TIME to walk there . The first applicant and PERSON had gone to the railway station but his wife had not been there . The first applicant had reported PERSON disappearance to the police station . Later his neighbours had told him that they had seen a white PERSON vehicle with a twisted front number plate at the spot where PERSON had been last seen . CARDINAL men of dark complexion had been sitting inside the PERSON . Villagers had also seen a light - blue UAZ vehicle with a big aerial on its top parked near the railway station that had driven away with the PERSON and CARDINAL other ORG vehicles . The first applicant himself had not seen any of those vehicles .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office questioned CARDINAL neighbours of the applicants , PERSON and PERSON They both stated that at TIME on DATE they had noticed a white PERSON vehicle parked near PERSON house with QUANTITY men inside it ; PERSON added that at some point she had heard the PERSON leaving .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office questioned PERSON as a witness who stated that at TIME on DATE he had seen PERSON turning into FAC . TIME he had turned into that street as well but had not seen the woman . A grey UAZ vehicle with a red cross on its back door had been parked near the railway station ; its windows had been dirty so PERSON had not seen who was inside it . The UAZ vehicle had driven off towards the centre of GPE .

DATE . On DATE Mr D. was questioned as a witness and submitted that at TIME he had spotted PERSON walking QUANTITY ahead of him . A new white PERSON vehicle had been parked QUANTITY from the applicants’ house ; CARDINAL men had been sitting in it , CARDINAL of whom was wearing a military - style pea coat . At some point the PERSON had started moving and had turned right in the direction in which PERSON had gone . Mr NORP had turned right as well but saw CARDINAL on the street . The PERSON which had been stationary QUANTITY from him had started moving .

CARDINAL . In DATE the district prosecutor ’s office questioned PERSON , PERSON , Ms NORP , PERSON , Mr T. and Mr A. , the applicants’ fellow villagers . They stated that PERSON had not been in conflict with anyone and that they had learned of her disappearance on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the first applicant was again questioned . He stated that he had learned from neighbours that the PERSON and ORG vehicles had arrived from the town of PERSON . Some of his fellow villagers had told him that PERSON had been taken away by law - enforcement officers who had produced their badges , but those persons were unwilling to make official depositions out of fear for their lives and the first applicant could not name them .

CARDINAL . On several occasions the investigators requested ORG , military commanders of different districts of GPE and district departments of the interior to carry out investigative measures related to PERSON disappearance and to submit information on whether any special operations had taken place in the village of GPE on DATE . According to the replies received , no such operations had been conducted and there was no information on PERSON arrest .
CARDINAL . The investigators sent a request to a commander of the special unit of ORG of ORG who , while on mission in GPE , had been duty at the checkpoint over LOC on DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the commander of the special unit of ORG of ORG informed the district prosecutor ’s office that no PERSON vehicle had appeared in the registration log for vehicles passing checkpoint PERSON over LOC .

CARDINAL . Police officers of the special unit of ORG of ORG who had been on duty at checkpoint KPP-CARDINAL on DATE were questioned as witnesses and stated that they had no information on PERSON disappearance or PERSON and ORG vehicles .
CARDINAL . The investigation into PERSON kidnapping remains pending .

DATE . Despite specific requests by ORG refused to disclose the entire investigation file in case no . DATE . Relying on the information obtained from ORG , the ORG stated that the investigation was in progress and that disclosure of the documents would be in violation of LAW , since the file contained information of a military nature and personal data concerning the witnesses or other participants in the criminal proceedings . The Government provided copies of the following documents : the decision to open the investigation of CARDINAL DATE , the decision of DATE to grant the first applicant victim status , transcripts of the first applicant ’s interviews of DATE , DATE and DATE , transcripts of interviews of PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , and the report of DATE by the commander of the special unit of ORG of ORG . They requested ORG to treat the documents submitted as confidential pursuant to LAW .
CARDINAL . For a summary of relevant domestic law see PERSON and PERSON GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE .
